website_summaries.verdict: One of the highest doses of vitamin A available in a supplement.
pros: Available in quantities of 100 or 250 softgels
Contains 25,000 IU of vitamin A in each dose
Some buyers noted it helped improve their acne
cons: The softgels are sensitive to heat and can stick together

customer_reviews.title: Be Warned: the product delivered is not the one that's shown
customer_reviews.text: This product is not what is shown here. It is NOT Vitamin A from fish oil alone. It is from retinyl palmitate and fish oil. Retinyl palmitate is toxic. The label on what I received is not what is shown here and the product is not either. The picture shows what I actually received.
customer_reviews.author: kojo

customer_reviews.title: Life changing buy
customer_reviews.text: I want to share real results, best thing that I’ve been able to try for acne I’ve tried all washes scubs masks you name it threw out hundreds of dollars seen a dermatologist nothing worked, this vitamin also relieved some of my symptoms of my monthly cycle!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: From Retinyl Palmitate and Fish Liver Oil
customer_reviews.text: The product picture shows 25,000 IU Vitamin A from Fish Liver Oil, the bottle received says "from Retinyl Palmitate and Fish Liver Oil." Others have mentined Retinyl Palmitate is a toxin, so this is definitely misleading.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rangel

customer_reviews.title: NOT RETINOL. ITS RETINYL PALMITATE
customer_reviews.text: This is not vitamin A retinol as sellers describe. I recently bought a new updated bottle that indicates the Vitamin A comes from Retinyl Palmitate, not Retinol. High concentrations of Retinyl Palmitate is bad for you which is probably why some reviewers are experiencing issues. The bottle comes in a very high dose.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas N.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best. Clears up my acne, psoriasis, and only skin/hair. Have been using for years.
customer_reviews.author: JessicaLS

customer_reviews.title: It works wonders.
customer_reviews.text: This product is heaven sent. I started getting bad ance about 5 years ago. Start taking this proudct in April 2018 along with Zinc... now my acne is history😉 Now brand is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Deprincess Onika

customer_reviews.title: So Happy with this Vitamin A
customer_reviews.text: I need this maximum Vitamin A potency for my rare skin disorder. In fact, many years ago I took it in 100K units every day, which I wish I could still get! I found this on Amazon & started taking it 2 months ago. My skin is the best it has been in years!! No acne, but extremely dry skin that no lotions or creams can alleviate. I knew Vitamin A taken internally was the only solution but have not been able to find it in more than 10K units. Thank you Amazon for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Collins

customer_reviews.title: Vitamin A is a must for clearing acne!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff has worked a miracle on my skin. I has reduced my oil production BIG time. I could see changed almost immediately but over the course of a couple months my skin has cleared almost completely. I did incorporate other supplements wihich aided this. -vitamin A -Zinc picolinate -Borage Oil -Niacinamde -Vitamin D3 -Hyaluronic Acid (For skin hydration) I have used every face wash in the book and supplementation is the only thing that has worked in clearing my skin.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Product not what's on label in description.
customer_reviews.text: What the hellll?!?!? I mean, great if you have acne and to take for a short period until it's gone, but NOT good as a daily or even bi-daily dietary supplement. Isn't just cod liver, but also RETINYL PALMITATE. No bueno for long term use. Returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: David T.

customer_reviews.title: Cured my cystic acne
customer_reviews.text: I broke out in cystic acne out of no where. I ordered this in hopes to help me cure this as I've read the reviews. I've been taking 2 a day for about 3 weeks. My skin is healing nicely and little to no more signs of acne. I will go down to once a day in probably a week. I will for sure be keeping this in my routine.
customer_reviews.author: tian.fitty

customer_reviews.title: CANCER CAUSING!
customer_reviews.text: Contains retinyl palmitate which has been show to accelerate tumor growth in lab animals.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: It cleared my chest and back acne!
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I heard it helped with acne. To my surprise, a week after using the vitamin A supplements, my chest and back acne which I could not get rid of cleared up. In a month it was completely gone. A year later I have no more problems with chest or back acne! I take two capsules a day. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Wadden

customer_reviews.title: Compare ingredients on advertised product to received product.
customer_reviews.text: Product was NOT as advertised. Ingredients shown on packaging in ad was not the ingredients in the product I received!
customer_reviews.author: Delores Merritt

customer_reviews.title: Quality product.
customer_reviews.text: Protects cells. Research what you are taking and why. Stay well my friends 💕

customer_reviews.title: Acne free!!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that has worked and cleared my face. I take 2 a day because just taking one didn’t do the trick for me ... it does dry my face so I have to take care to make sure I moisturize.

customer_reviews.title: but it seemed to not help but worse my skin condition

customer_reviews.text: Great for the eyes and well priced ! High Potency !

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for vitamin A with a good price!
customer_reviews.text: Very please I found Now brand supplements & happy with the results of taking them. I feel this is a quality product at a very good price. If you are like me & cannot convert beta carotene into vitamin A, this would be good choice.

customer_reviews.title: his doctor recommendation
customer_reviews.text: I got it for my husband. He used this for his face acne. Easy to take. It works well according to him.

customer_reviews.text: Great company, No extra fillers. Always pleased with this company

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My skin has actually started looking healthier! I have that "chicken skin" issue and it seems to be helping.

customer_reviews.text: Small pills easy to swallow but have a slight fishy smell

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It helps a lot with acne. My face is pretty much clear all the time.

customer_reviews.title: They are good quality vitamins
customer_reviews.text: They are good quality vitamins, but be aware if you are ordering during the heat of summer: they came sticky and clumped together as they sat on my hot front steps for most of the day.
customer_reviews.author: NikoBlue

customer_reviews.title: Raises triglycerides!
customer_reviews.text: Sent my triglycerides soaring over 800! Don't take this much Vitamin A if you have high triglycerides. Settle for what you get from fruits & veggies. Also, this gives you fishy burps.
customer_reviews.author: Concord Hill

customer_reviews.title: High dose, good price, no side effects
customer_reviews.text: I am using this to help keep my acne under control. You have to be careful about the dose, I take it twice a day for a total of 50,000 iu which is a lot. I check my liver function tests on a regular basis. Liver toxicity has been reported on doses as low as 15,000 iu per day. Check with your doctor before you take this product. If your doctor has no idea, find another doctor!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sinclair

customer_reviews.title: Directions may have dangerous affects
customer_reviews.text: Don't go by the directions, my doctor said 25,000 IU's a day is harmful to the liver and kidneys, my doctor said take this only once a week. Other than that it's a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Helped acne
customer_reviews.text: Definitely helped my acne but I know it can be toxic. I took one pill every other day and saw an improvement in conjunction with differin gel and cleaning with rosehip oil to balance my sebum production.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my dog with suggestion from vet. Helps with his blackheads on his back!

customer_reviews.text: Probably best to go with a smaller size pill. These run into the same issue as omega 3 fish oil -- can give you weird tasting burps. I haven't ever run into that issue with 10,000iu.

customer_reviews.text: The IU is very high and made my stomach hurt after a week of use. Not sure if you are supposed to take it daily?

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed

I've taken these consistently everyday and even upped the dosage to 2 softgels a day to see some sort of improvement in my skin as many have reported they did. It may have worked for some, but for me, I feel as this was a complete waste of money. I didn't notice ANYTHING.

customer_reviews.title: Small, easy to swallow supplement!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Vitamin A supplement after much research, to help with my cystic acne prone skin. I am about 3 weeks into taking the pills, and have yet to have a new cystic breakout. I have had smaller pimples, but nothing like the large cysts that I normally encounter at least once a week. At only 3weeks in this could be a fluke, but I'm hoping not! I'm not expecting a miracle, but so far it seems to be helping at least a little bit. The pills are easy enough to take, very small. It's worth a try!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan8407

customer_reviews.title: No more Acne
customer_reviews.text: This product is potent and cleared up my acne quickly. Make sure you don't take too much it is hepato toxic.

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant. I had large cystic acne on my cheeks that showed no signs of stopping. I have used this product for 4 months. In the last 2 weeks, all i've had is 3 tiny pimples on my forehead (it might have been irritation from a new cap). I've had no acne on my cheeks in over a month. Highly recommended.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.title: I usually love this brand but I have never been so sick ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm sorry, I usually love this brand but I have never been so sick after taking one pill! My stomach is in shreds two days later! I threw them away just to make sure I don't accidentally take one ever again. If you have a sensitive stomach, and even if you don't, definitely be careful with this.

customer_reviews.title: Vit A
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff. Works for my family and I as well as on our animals. Clears up horse hoof abscesses quickly. Great if the dogs get sore also.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works for acneeeeeeee. I can't believe it ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff works for acneeeeeeee. I can't believe it. I had very mild acne all my life and tried almost everything to make it go away. After a few days I notice I stopped breaking out. After 2 weeks I barely got a single pimple anymore. My skin has never been so clear. Buy this!
customer_reviews.author: bootman

customer_reviews.title: It didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The purpose of taking this vitamin was to try to replicate the effects of Accutane. 14 years ago I was on 40mg of Accutane for 6 months, and I considered it a miracle drug. But it seems that my acne has started to rear it's head a little, and my skin is super oily. I know that my dermatologist would not prescribe Accutane to me again because it's not cystic. I got up to 100 IU for about 2.5 months and to be honest, I don't see much of a difference. I thought for sure my skin would dry up like with the Accutane, but it has not. Plus, the soft-gels gave me the fish burps like crazy :(
customer_reviews.author: Meow99

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: i loved the product very much...it is excellent it is delivered on time thank you for your service.
customer_reviews.author: Ashish kalal

customer_reviews.title: Worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I bought Vitamin A to help keep my face from getting so oily. I read somewhere that it calms your oil-producing glands. It worked for me immediately. The skin on my face has a glow to it now, and I don't have to wash it halfway through the day from feeling so greasy. Large quantity for a good price,

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed

customer_reviews.title: No more large painful cystic acne

I have had very clear acne free skin since taking vitamin A regularly. The best thing is that the 3-5 large deep painful cystic acne that I always had erupting somewhere at any given time have been completely eliminated. I have tried many supplements including vitamin A and from many brands and never been disappointed with Now products.

But I've used this for many years, and I appreciate being able to buy it here for a relatively reasonable price.

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT take without a Doctor's orders! Overdosed!
customer_reviews.text: I have been taking this for under two weeks, the last few days I have had increasing symptoms of Vitamin A overdose - itching all over, dry/flaking skin, cracks at the corners of my mouth, and several even more unpleasant side effects. This supplement contains I believe 500% of the daily recommended allowance of Vitamin A. This is way too easy to cause permanent health damage with, do not take this dose without a prescription from your physician.
customer_reviews.author: RecoverInBeautyTop Contributor: Nail Art

customer_reviews.title: Helped my skin a little bit!
customer_reviews.text: Vitamin A helped me clear my skin a little bit but doesnt reduce oil production. The first two weeks I purged but now I only get one or two zits per week. This works in combination with a daily routine. I take one everyday in the morning. Its been about 5 weeks since I started taking it. I also use 5% benzol peroxide when I break out.

My face has made a noticeable improvement though so I would recommend it.

customer_reviews.title: recommended by Danny Roddy of the bioenergetic podcast
customer_reviews.text: Its too large a dose for me and I'm not 100% sure of the quality. Did little to help my skin, but your results may vary. Switched to Nutrisorb A, recommended by Danny Roddy of the bioenergetic podcast. One drop has 2,500 iu of pure vitamin a from a vegetarian source (no pcbs or lead contamination possible from fish). In contrast one drop of this has 50% dv of vitamin A where as this pill has a full 5 days worth. I think it's overload for my system, couldn't find a smaller dose from fish.

customer_reviews.title: worked great in that regard
customer_reviews.text: Since it's a mega dose of vitamin A i just used these for topical applications, worked great in that regard.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Burnette

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to find gel pills of vitamin A anywhere, and in high IU (25,000 IU for this product). Use them for my acne and vitamin A works. I used 75,000 IU per day for 4 weeks, 50,000 IU per day for 4 weeks, and around 25,000 per day for 4 weeks. It may cause joint discomfort and other side effects. Beware of vitamin A toxicity and please please consult a doctor before doing high doses of this as I do not claim to be a doctor but this did work for me personally.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: get it!
customer_reviews.text: I have really acne prone skin. ... I was on Accutane for six months about 4 years ago... about 6 months ago I started noticing that I was breaking out.... I started scanning the Internet and came across these miracle workers! Amazing! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: richelle ruiter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for skin issues
customer_reviews.text: I am a male who is nearly 30. I've struggled with moderate acne my whole life. Nothing incredibly severe, but enough to be really embarrassing at my age. I've been taking this for about two weeks, and my face is clearer than it's EVER been. Aside from the fact that this supplement has cleared up my skin and reduced the oil on the surface of my face, I'm also super impressed with Now Foods supplements. I've made them my go-to company for any supplements because I know they are pure and trustworthy. I would highly recommend this product, as I would most Now products.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Dongleson

customer_reviews.title: Here is article about recommended daily value of Vitamin A
customer_reviews.text: It is hard to believe they don't mention in the description that the label says: California Proposition 65 Warning: This product contains a chemical known to the State of California to cause birth defects or other reproductive harm. Here is article about recommended daily value of Vitamin A.
customer_reviews.author: A.

customer_reviews.title: My Answer for Acne
customer_reviews.text: So, this product does exactly what it sells to do: 5 stars. However, I had a negative reaction. Large amounts of vitamin A affect serotonin production in the brain and can lead to feelings of depression, lethargy, etc. That was the case for me. I still squeeze this stuff on my skin for some night treatments, and it does help, but I wouldn't recommend taking it orally. I took a vitamin D supplement alongside this to supposedly help with the side effects, but it was generally ineffective. Please be cautious when taking any kind of supplement and do your research beforehand. We all react differently to substances.
customer_reviews.author: AMkermet
